title: Graph Neural Networks for Treatment Effect Prediction
abstract: arXiv:2403.19289v1 Announce Type: cross  Abstract: Estimating causal effects in e-commerce tends to involve costly treatment assignments which can be impractical in large-scale settings. Leveraging machine learning to predict such treatment effects without actual intervention is a standard practice to diminish the risk. However, existing methods for treatment effect prediction tend to rely on training sets of substantial size, which are built from real experiments and are thus inherently risky to create. In this work we propose a graph neural network to diminish the required training set size, relying on graphs that are common in e-commerce data. Specifically, we view the problem as node regression with a restricted number of labeled instances, develop a two-model neural architecture akin to previous causal effect estimators, and test varying message-passing layers for encoding. translated_title: 用于治疗效果预测的图神经网络
translated_abstract: 在电子商务中估计因果效应往往涉及昂贵的治疗分配，这在大规模设置中可能是不切实际的。利用机器学习来预测这种治疗效果而无需实际干预是减少风险的一种标准做法。然而，现有的治疗效果预测方法往往依赖于大规模实验构建的训练集，因此从根本上存在风险。在这项工作中，我们提出了一种图神经网络，以减少所需的训练集大小，依赖于电子商务数据中常见的图。具体地，我们将问题视为具有有限数量标记实例的节点回归，开发了一个类似于先前因果效应估计器的双模型神经架构，并测试了不同的消息传递层进行编码。此外，作为额外步骤，我们将模型与获取函数相结合，以引导信息传递。
tldr: 提出了一种图神经网络来减少治疗效果预测所需的训练集大小，有效利用电子商务数据的图结构，为治疗效果预测带来新的可能性
en_tdlr: Introducing a graph neural network to reduce the required training set size for treatment effect prediction, leveraging the graph structure common in e-commerce data, and opening up new possibilities for treatment effect prediction.
